model_answer: The reason for using control plates and asking the patient to name the symbols on the Hardy Rand Rittler pseudo-isochromatic color plates is to test the patient's color vision. These plates screen for red-green defects and blue-yellow defects. The patient should be able to recognize the symbols on the plates as a way to assess their color perception. Option D correctly explains the purpose of this part of the examination.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on ophthalmology for help. The purpose of placing a neutral density filter over the left eye during the swinging light test is to reduce the light perceived by the left eye to simulate an afferent pupillary defect; this allows the examiner to assess the patient's response to light on the affected side.

Therefore, the answer is (A).
